title.jp: Ore no Imouto no Jinsei Soudan ga Kore de Owaru Wake ga Nai: True Route

synopsis: Alternative version of episode 12, featuring the original light novel storyline, as opposed to the anime-original ending in the TV episode 12.

title.jp: Ore no Kouhai ga Konna ni Kusatteru Wake ga Nai

synopsis: Kuroneko (real name: Gokou Ruri) enrolls in Kyousuke's school, and Saori feels downhearted that she hasn't heard from Kirino. Kyousuke notices that Ruri is having trouble making friends due to her personality, so he decides they should try a membership at their school's Games Research club where the boy meets two other persons he never expected to be there as well.

title.jp: Ore no Kouhai ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai

synopsis: With Sena and Kuroneko constantly quarreling in the Games Development club, the club president decides they'll have to write a game together and submit it to an online contest. Both girls have different concepts about the game's theme, so they'll both present them to the club whose members will then decide by majority vote whose concept will have to be implemented. And Kyousuke, with no programming skills thus acting as supervisor for the team, suggests to write an eroge - in order to have less competition and a better chance to win the contest.

title.jp: Ore no Imouto ga Kore de Saishuukai na Wake ga Nai

synopsis: As Ruri and Sena's game is bashed on the internet, they decide to work harder towards making a better game. As Kyosuke prepares to go home, he receives a text from Kirino telling him to throw away her collection of eroge and anime goods. Kyosuke contacts Ayase, who reveals Kirino has not been in contact with her since she left either. Kyosuke then meets up with Ruri, who reveals her heartfelt thanks for helping her fit into school and encourages Kyosuke to fly to America to find the root of Kirino's problem, giving him a kiss on the cheek as he goes. Arriving in Los Angeles, Kyosuke meets up with Kirino at her track camp and plays eroge with her, cheering her up as she has not had time to play her collection. Kirino reveals that she had wanted to challenge herself and be more independent, saying she would not contact anyone until she managed to beat someone in a time trial, which she has not been able to do. Kyosuke tells Kirino that he is lonely without her and asks her to come back to Japan, which encourages Kirino to beat her elementary school roommate in a race and go home with him, reuniting with her friends and her anime.
